Description: Fragment of undyed linen plain weave with big roundel in purple wool and undyed linen tapestry on grouped threads; decoration is of one large central circle with geometric motifs (cross motifs in a square and stylised interlacing in a hexagon), this is framed with a solid outline of purple wool and a freize of interlacing creating circular medallions with floral and vegetal outlines in each centre, there are dots between each medallion; sewn onto a modern, beige plain weave; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S/10); tapestry: warp-undyed linen (grouped by 2/9 ribs per cm), weft-undyed linen (S), purple wool (S/54); flying threads in undyed linen (S);
Curator's comments: includes with a bag of sticky label of cardboard "21516 Roundel from a linen cloth with a tapestry-woven geometric design in purple wool and undyed linen thread. Ivth-Vth Cent. A.D."; on the bag is written "EA21516 Coptic (bit conserved-was attached to same mount as textiles remounted for Coptic corridor)";
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
